sentences.en: A translator shouldn't intrude his own opinions into what he's translating.
sentences.cn: 译者不应该擅自把自己的意思加进译文中。

sentences.en: An American officer on the scene said no one had intruded into the space he was defending.
sentences.cn: 现场的一名美国军官说还没有人闯入过他所防卫的区域。

sentences.en: Do you feel anxious when unforeseen incidents intrude on your day?
sentences.cn: 当意外事件干扰了你的生活时，你会感到焦虑吗？

sentences.en: Don't intrude in a family dispute.
He did not want to intrude on this grief.
sentences.cn: 他不愿意牵连到这个悲剧中去.

sentences.en: He tried to intrude his opinions on me.
sentences.cn: 他想把他的意见强加给我.

sentences.en: I am afraid that I intrude upon you.
I do not want to intrude if you are busy.
sentences.cn: 如果你忙我就不打扰你了.

sentences.en: I don't want to intrude my opinion upon you.
sentences.cn: 我不想把我的意见强加于你.

sentences.en: I don't want to intrude on your meeting.
sentences.cn: 我不想打扰你们的会议。

sentences.en: I don't want to intrude upon your secrets.
I'm sorry to intrude on you like this.
I'm sorry to intrude, but I need to talk to someone.
sentences.cn: 对不起打扰了，不过我得找人有话要说。

sentences.en: The press has been blamed for intruding into people's personal lives in an unacceptable way.
sentences.cn: 新闻媒体因以一种令人无法接受的方式侵入人们的私生活而受到谴责。

sentences.en: There are times when personal feelings cannot be allowed to intrude.
sentences.cn: 有些时候是不允许夹杂个人感情的。

sentences.en: Would I be intruding if I came with you?
sentences.cn: 我要是和你一起去，会不会打扰你？

trans.tran_en: to come into a place or situation, and have an unwanted effect

trans.tran_cn: 侵入，侵扰，打扰，闯入，打扰
trans.tran_en: to interrupt someone or become involved in their private affairs in an annoying and unwanted way

trans.tran_cn: 把观点强加于他人，[地质]侵入其他地层，把…硬挤
trans.tran_en: to interrupt someone or become involved in their private affairs in an annoying and unwanted way
